summary: Betty Boop is a famous cartoon character created by Grim Natwick for Fleischer Studios. She first appeared in the 1930s in the *Talkartoon* and *Betty Boop* cartoon series. With her unique look—a baby face, big eyes, and a confident personality—she became a symbol of the Jazz Age. Betty appeared in 90 cartoons and was very popular, even after her design was changed to follow new rules about what was allowed in movies. She is still well-known today and has been on comic strips and many products.
title: Betty Boop
